reviewText: It wasn't as much about the Grecian Gods/Goddesses as I hoped but it was a good summary of them and I learned a few things I didn't know before.  Its more about Greek battles after, but they do a good job of that.  As long as you are interested in that too, its worth it.
My son wasn't very interested in learning history, but after we watched some of the battles in this set he was energized to learn more.
I had been wanting this for a while, and then when I saw the sale price I couldn't pass it up!

Excellent videos on "Last Stand of the 300" and the "Marathon" Video. Also, "Battles BC: Alexander: Lord of War" also fairly historically accurate. "Gods and Goddesses" also rates an "A" as well as "In Search of History: Oracle at Delphi". But,
there seems to be some repetitive other videos. Rate them C+.

I teach freshmen English classes, and his was excellent to use and make worksheets for supplementary information during our Greek Mythology unit.  The students enjoyed most of them too which is always an added bonus :)

I got this to use as a supplement to the unit I teach on ancient Greece to middle school students.  Several elements of it are interesting, especially using game technology to show the outcomes of battles.  I would say that, in typical history channel fashion, there is a bit of...sensationalism that goes along with the information.  While this does help keep my students interested, I have to back peadal a bit on some of the things said.

This DVD set is made up of documentaries of variable quality.  The documentaries "Gods and Goddesses," "The Greek Gods," and "Oracle at Delphi" are worth watching.  The documentaries about battles are too often overburdened with computer generated images that make them at times look like video games.  The documentary "Troy: The Passion of Helen," is by far the worst of all these documentaries.  This fluffy documentary is of limited interest to any history buff.  In summary, this DVD set is in dire need of some retooling.
Great product. Perfect.
the problem is that much of it is not suitable for kids
Detailed Greek history.  Greek lovers must have.
good product and a good price!
BORED WITH IT.
Excellent.
Very informative and well done.
It was okay but nothing I didn't already know.
Arrived as stated, new and packaged properly.
too much war
the ancient greeks were remarkable people in both their mythology and their battles that have continued to be remembered to this day.
Great video with plenty of episodes. Well worth the money. I use them to supplement a mythology class I teach for college. Great buy.
I love the DVD, but unfortunaly it does not have subtitles even in English. I intended to use it in class to discuss some topics. It was hard for  non native students.
Excellent
I really liked the movie 300 Spartans and this helped me learn about this period in time.  I enjoy learning more about Ancient Greece and this was an enjoyable way to expand my knowledge.

History is very much of interest to me as try to become more acquainted with pieces of history that I am not familiar.  It seems as time passes, what I have learned in the past has become fuzzy.  I like having references that I can restore sections of history that I should have remembered from my time in school.  Thanks for making this section of history available.

The battle DVD's were interesting, particularly when military strategy is explained. The rest are inappropriate for school children. I wish the History Channel had offered the battle disks separate from the rest, in a collection geared strictly from schools.  I actually had to preview each disk, because none of them had parental guiding ratings.
Impressive history, love this DVD set. Very informational, better than history class in school. Great detail. Both of my teenage daughters have borrowed the DVD set for homework.

This one is better than the history channel middle ages dvds but not great.  It is pretty detailed and well presented and better than
average for this type of documentary.

Great study of ancient battles.  Never realized Greece was so violent and militarized.
Famous battles anazlyed and graphically explained. The 300 included.
Excellent DVD and service, thank you.
I'm a graduate student in Classical Studies.  Within the first 10 minutes of watching this I heard so much rubbish that I turned it off and threw the DVDs in the trash.  Do not waste your money.
Ahead of schedule delivery.  Very pleased
